abstract: "Charging Bull," the well-known Wall Street statue in Lower Manhattan, has been barricaded to most visitors since the Occupy Wall Street protests began. That doesn't sit well with Arthur Piccolo, the chairman of the Bowling Green Association, who has emerged as the statue's unlikely champion. "Would you put these barricades around the Statue of Liberty?" he told New York magazine. "How about St. Patrick's Cathedral?"
